organization.fullName: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Different Treatment Strategies on Prognosis of Acute Ischemic Stroke(AISDTS)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Study on the Effect of Different Treatment Strategies on Prognosis of Acute Ischemic Stroke(AISDTS)

leadSponsor.name: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: AISDTS is a prospective registry study, in which clinical information, examination and imaging data of patients with acute ischemic stroke receiving different treatment strategies were collected, grouped and statistically analyzed, and corresponding clinical prediction models were constructed to explore the role of clinical biological indicators in the occurrence and development of stroke.

bioSpec.description: Blood samples were collected from routine blood sample.

armGroups.label: thrombolysis group
armGroups.description: Inclusion criteria: a) age ≥18 years; B) hospital admission for acute ischemic stroke; C) the time from onset to admission ≤ 4.5 hours; D) received intravenous thrombolysis; E) signed informed consent.

armGroups.label: thrombectomy group
armGroups.description: Inclusion criteria: a) age ≥18 years; B) hospital admission for acute ischemic stroke; C) the time from onset to admission ≤ 24 hours; D) vascular assessment by CTA or multimodal MRI; E) received thrombectomy; F) signed informed consent.

armGroups.label: stent group
armGroups.description: Inclusion criteria: a) age ≥18 years; B) hospital admission due to ischemic stroke; C) vascular assessment by CTA or multimodal MRI; D) received stent implantation ; E) Signed informed consent.

armGroups.label: regular treatment group
armGroups.description: Inclusion criteria: a) age ≥18 years; B) hospital admission due to ischemic stroke; C) received regular medical treatment; D) signed informed consent.

armGroups.label: young stroke group
armGroups.description: Inclusion criteria: a) age between 18 and 50 years of age (45/55Y); B) hospital admission due to ischemic stroke; C) received CT or MRI imaging assessment; D) signed informed consent.

armGroups.label: unexplained stroke group
armGroups.description: Inclusion criteria: a) age ≥18 years; B) hospital admission due to ischemic stroke; C) Received CT or MRI imaging assessment; D)TOAST was classified as unknown cause type (including two or more causes and no cause was found by auxiliary examination); E) signed informed consent.

primaryOutcomes.measure: To assess the changes of prognosis of stroke patients under different treatment strategies
primaryOutcomes.description: assessed by The Modified Rankin Score (mRS) of stroke patients \[mild to wores ranging from 0 to 5, 6 represents death\].

primaryOutcomes.measure: To assess the early neurological changes of ischemic stroke
primaryOutcomes.description: change from baseline National Institute of Health stroke scalescore (NIHSS) \[higher scores mean worse conditions\]7 days or 14 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To assess the incidence of recurrent stroke under different treatment strategies
secondaryOutcomes.description: record and analyze the incidence of recurrent stroke from 7 days-24 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To assess the types and incidence of adverse events of ischemic stroke patients
secondaryOutcomes.description: adverse reactions (hemorrhage, embolus shedding, gastrointestinal ulcer) and stroke-related complications under different treatment strategies

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To assess the correlation of RNA/DNA and age factor in acute ischemic stroke
secondaryOutcomes.description: DNA and RNA extracted from peripheral blood samples

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To assess the therapeutical effects of Edaravone dexborneol on inflammation and prognosis after acute ischemic stroke
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Modified Rankin Score score (mRS) of stroke patients \[mild to wores ranging from 0 to 5, 6 represents death\].

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* A) ≥18 years of age; B) hospital admission for ischemic stroke; C) Signed informed consent.

Exclusion Criteria:

* A) patients with incomplete clinical information; B) hospitalization observation time less than 24 hours; C) recent trauma, severe inflammation, severe liver and kidney dysfunction, progressive malignance and other serious diseases; D) baseline mRS score\>2; E) informed consent is not signed.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients admitted to hospital for ischemic stroke were enrolled.

locations.facility: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University
